content.description:
This is the longest, most sustained, and in my opinion best route on this boulder. 

  Start on a shelf at the right side of the thumbs up boulder. Traverse left until your head is just above the ground, grab for the thumb, then move right to top out,

Sit start with a sloping left hand pocket-like hold and right hand low on a positive pinch. Pull on with some low feet and lockoff to a good hold out right. From here smack into an awesome sloping pinch then fire for the lip. Once matched on the lip mantle direct or head out right and top out near the apex.
content.location: This problem is found on the middle of the overhang on the second trailside Twin Boulder. It is located between "Soul Salvage" and "Blood Brothers".

content.description: Sit start under the short overhang with a right hand mini-pinch/ rail and left hand on a poor hold out left, or start matched on the right starting hold. Pull onto the wall and fire for the sloping lip of the overhang. Once here, wrestle your way up in order to stand on top of the block.
content.location: This problem is on the trailside face of the second twin boulder. It is located far left where the overhang becomes fairly short.

content.description: Sit start on the obvious jug and climb straight up. Not bad movement, just a bit tight between the large flake that was peeled off the wall and the boulder to the right.
content.location: Between the two Twin Boulders, there is a corridor that this is just inside the corridor on the right wall.

content.description: Start laying down under the right side of the cave/overhang. Left hand on flake feature and right hand on little side pull pocket. Make a big move to the rail and traverse into the problem "Grace is Gone". Finish on "Grace is Gone".
content.location: Located on the same boulder with "Grace is Gone"

content.description: Start on an obvious crimp above head height with really good feet on the rock that curls out at the bottom. Once you have matched on this horizontal crimp move your preferred hand up to an angled crimp, move your feet up and go to the lip and top out.I stumbled across this problem and it had chalk on it already so I don't know the proper name or FA info, if anyone out there knows let me know and I will update accordingly.
content.protection: Pads and spotter, the fall is mostly clean but is a little tight between a few boulders.
content.location: While not technically on the Twin Boulders, this climb is located just behind and to the right of the right Twin Boulder. Walk to the right of the right Twin Boulder and you will see this overhanging face.

content.description:
Squat start with you left hand on the left arete and right on a crimp near the right arete. Throw up a left heel and squeeze up the two arete's using a variety of holds.  

  This problem climbs well, albeit a bit sharp in places. Not a super long route but a fun one to do.
content.location: This is located to the left of Copperline and faces Blood Brothers. Squeeze up the two aretes.

content.description: There are two cux's one which is getting off the ground and the other is the move to the top. Start start on large rail that makes the bottom of Cleaned on Lead and climb the right angling seam up and to the top.
content.location: Shares a start with Cleaned on Lead but breaks right and climbs the right angling seam. This is just to the right of the easily reconizable Grace is Gone/Two Thumbs Up over hang.

content.description:
This route is dirty but once clean will be a really fun route, I think it already is but I like an element of dirt and grime... 

  Sit start on a really sharp rail a foot right of the Copperline (V2) arete. Work up and right using a variety of holds. There are many different ways to do this but each way stays about the same grade. Trend up and right finishing in the rock that looks loose but is actually very solid.
content.protection: Pad, spotter and tape for the really sharp rock.
content.location: Start one foot right of the starting holds of Copperline V2 and climb up and right into the top part that looks broken but is actually solid.

content.description: A powerful one-mover with a tricky top-out. Stand start with a left hand undercling and a right hand slopey edge to the right. Pull onto the wall with difficulty and smack up to a hold at the lip, match and get on top.
content.location: This problem is found on the long trailside face of the first of the two boulders. This problem lies between "The Noble Lie" and "Copperline".

content.description:
This is a short little cave/overhang just around the corner from The Twin Boulders.  

  Sit start on an obvious jug and throw a heel up on the same rail system. Reach up to a good edge then bump the to jug at the lip and top out. 

  This route is short but it is extremely fun and a good intro to overhanging bouldering.
content.location: Walk past Blood Brothers and go around to the corner and this will be the little roof/cave/overhang you see with an obvious starting hold.

content.description: Stand start on the clean blank face behind a small cluster of small trees on two good crimps with large feet. Move left hand up to a good rounded crimp, then move you feet up and reach for a cool quartz hold up high. This is the crux and will be harder for short climbers because the feet wont be as good. Top out into the forest :)
content.location: On the right boulder of The Twin Boulders this route climbs the clean less than vertical face to the right of Moon Light Lady (V0). Look for the horn near the top and start directly below it.

content.description:
First off this route if fun and can be made much harder if you don't hold the holds right and you miss a key knee bar.  

  Sit start on two good hold and make a long move up to a left hand pinch on the arete, being careful not to cut your feet. Once you have the pinch move you right hand up to a sharp right hand just below your left then get your feet up and move to sloper-jug out left with you left hand. Knee-bar and move hands up to the top out. Hint for the top out don't just think straight up, left might be a good place to look. 

  The route is dirty on the top out and a few other patches of copper colored moss, for which the route was named (and because Copperline by James Taylor is a great song). 

  This is a new route but the rock is solid :)
content.protection: Pad, spotter and tape for the sharp rock.
content.location: On the right of The Twin Boulders this climbs the blunt arete in the middle of the boulder trending right to left. The line is obvious the moves are not.

content.description: crux at bottom and top...sit start ups the dificulty
content.location: the face just right of the "thumbs up" boulder (you'll know when you see it)

content.description: This climbs the slightly overhung face just left of the right arete on the left of The Twin Boulders.Sit start on a good slightly sloped shelf and move up to the next similar shelf. Pick some feet and fire into the good but really sharp left side of the pinch/hueco. Then encounter the crux, the top out.The route is named because Tim Mijal and I both shed blood on this route on the hueco/pinch.
content.location: On the left of The Twin Boulders this climbs the slightly overhung face just left of the right hand arete starting on an obvious slightly sloped ledge.

content.description: Sit start matched on a pocket-like mini-pinch found on the short overhang. (This is the same start as for "Soul Salvage".) Pull on and fire for the sloping lip, match, then traverse the sloping lip all the way right and top out on the apex as for "Blood Brothers".
content.location: This problem climbs the whole lip of the second Twin Boulder. A start on the lip further left is possible, more awkward and also easier than starting as for "Soul Salvage".

content.description:
The boulders are located in west Blackjack Boulders, but because of the potential they deserve their own section. 

  The rocks are not tall, average about ten feet tall, they are sharp but have a lot of hard and fun potential. I would recommend bringing tape with you if you are going here because they boulders haven't been climbed so they are really sharp. The lines are on overhanging rock so they are fairly clean but I do plan on giving the a good scrubbing when I have sometime on my hands. 

  The classic line here so far is Blood Brothers V3. 

  (Pictures will be coming soon)
